column4: I'm trying to do an apt-get upgrade and it seems like i can't contact the servers. when I try to ping it (ping ca.archive.ubuntu.com
can anybody help me out here?
did you try to ping archive.ubuntu.com ?
I can also ping ca.archive.ubuntu.com from my computer here. (I'm in the US, the computer i'm trying to update is in canada)
than your national server is down.. simply edit /etc/apt/sources.list to use the base servers
maybe some routing problem... hapens sometime
any way to get around that without futzing up the sources ?
the only thing that comes in mind that there is somewhere a fireall which is blocking the server
yea. i told him to turn off his firewall though.. i'm trusting him on that
maybe it is the ISP-s firewall, or some other somewhere
it's possible, i hear they throttle bittorrent as well
i ame in the other side of the planet :D
